page.title: 11INDUSTRIAL ESTATE 1
page.content: The decline of major employers, like AB Cranes, has led to an increase in the importance of small firms employing a handful of people. At Heath Hill, Lawley, a small industrial estate has grown up, with an assortment of small manufacturing and service industries. Using premises rented from Telford Development Corporation, a couple of dozen firms are now based here. For example, there is 'Mendak', employing 12 people, who make fume and dust filtration systems. 'Denman's Electrical', who are electrical wholesalers, employing 5 people, and of 5 years standing. 'Hydromech Ltd', making hydraulic tools and employing 10 people. 'Betta Bodies', established four years ago, employing 4 people full-time in car repairs. One of the largest firms is 'Occo', with 14 employees, who make
